member.name: T:Telerik.UI.Xaml.Controls.Data.Common.SwipeEaseFunction
member.summary:
Represent Parabola function to accelerate the original offset up. The ease used is EasyInOut : ____ L | / | / | / | / |/_________ offset D
In addition it translates the maxSwipeLength to stretchLimit (L) proportionally as MaxScrollStretch is the max stretch that scrollviewer can allow.
The function is calculated as following: - swipeTheshold / 2 >= acceleratedOffset --> 2 * swipeTheshold/maxSwipeLength^2 * offset^2 - acceleratedOffset > swipeTheshold / 2 and swipeTheshold > swipeTheshold --> swipeTheshold - 2 * swipeTheshold /maxSwipeLength^2 * (maxSwipeLength - offset) ^ 2.

member.summary: Gets or sets the relative size of the UI virtualization buffers to the height of the viewport. The size of the UI virtualization buffers is defined by multiplying the height of the viewport by the value defined on this property. If the minimum value of the UI virtualization buffers according to this scale falls below 800 pixels, the value of 800 pixels is used as a value.

member.name: T:Telerik.UI.Xaml.Controls.Data.HexView.FlatLooseHexLayoutDefinition
member.summary: Layout definition that arranges the hexagonal elements in a honeycomb pattern. If the is vertical, the hexagons are flat, otherwise they are rotated 90 degrees and become angled. The elements are arranged so that the rows are completely filled (this leaves some spacing between the elements).

member.name: T:Telerik.UI.Xaml.Controls.Data.HexView.FlatTightHexLayoutDefinition
member.summary: Layout definition that arranges the hexagonal elements in a honeycomb pattern. If the is vertical, the hexagons are flat, otherwise they are rotated 90 degrees and become angled. The elements are arranged alternatively on the current and the next row so that there is no spacing between them.

member.name: M:Telerik.Data.Core.Layouts.LayoutDoubleUtil.AreClose(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: AreClose - Returns whether or not two doubles are "close". That is, whether or not they are within epsilon of each other. Note that this epsilon is proportional to the numbers themselves to that AreClose survives scalar multiplication. There are plenty of ways for this to return false even for numbers which are theoretically identical, so no code calling this should fail to work if this returns false. This is important enough to repeat: NB: NO CODE CALLING THIS FUNCTION SHOULD DEPEND ON ACCURATE RESULTS - this should be used for optimizations *only*.
member.returns: Boolean - the result of the AreClose comparison.

member.name: M:Telerik.Data.Core.Layouts.LayoutDoubleUtil.GreaterThan(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: GreaterThan - Returns whether or not the first double is greater than the second double. That is, whether or not the first is strictly greater than *and* not within epsilon of the other number. Note that this epsilon is proportional to the numbers themselves to that AreClose survives scalar multiplication. Note, There are plenty of ways for this to return false even for numbers which are theoretically identical, so no code calling this should fail to work if this returns false. This is important enough to repeat: NB: NO CODE CALLING THIS FUNCTION SHOULD DEPEND ON ACCURATE RESULTS - this should be used for optimizations *only*.
member.returns: Boolean - the result of the GreaterThan comparison.

member.name: M:Telerik.Data.Core.Layouts.LayoutDoubleUtil.GreaterThanOrClose(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: GreaterThanOrClose - Returns whether or not the first double is greater than or close to the second double. That is, whether or not the first is strictly greater than or within epsilon of the other number. Note that this epsilon is proportional to the numbers themselves to that AreClose survives scalar multiplication. Note, There are plenty of ways for this to return false even for numbers which are theoretically identical, so no code calling this should fail to work if this returns false. This is important enough to repeat: NB: NO CODE CALLING THIS FUNCTION SHOULD DEPEND ON ACCURATE RESULTS - this should be used for optimizations *only*.
member.returns: Boolean - the result of the GreaterThanOrClose comparison.

member.name: M:Telerik.Data.Core.Layouts.LayoutDoubleUtil.IsZero(System.Double)
member.summary: IsZero - Returns whether or not the double is "close" to 0. Same as AreClose(double, 0), but this is faster.
member.returns: Boolean - the result of the IsZero comparison.

member.name: M:Telerik.Data.Core.Layouts.LayoutDoubleUtil.LessThan(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: LessThan - Returns whether or not the first double is less than the second double. That is, whether or not the first is strictly less than *and* not within epsilon of the other number. Note that this epsilon is proportional to the numbers themselves to that AreClose survives scalar multiplication. Note, There are plenty of ways for this to return false even for numbers which are theoretically identical, so no code calling this should fail to work if this returns false. member.summary: Enables the IOrientedParent to layout its elements in a specified order
member.remarks: Use the following terms throught the layout module: - Id - uniquely identifies the index of an item in the source view - Slot - identifies the row/column index depending on the orientation in the layout. member.summary: Defines the different modes for item animation support in .

member.name: F:Telerik.UI.Xaml.Controls.Data.ItemAnimationMode.None
member.summary: No item animations are played.

member.name: F:Telerik.UI.Xaml.Controls.Data.ItemAnimationMode.PlayOnNewSource
member.summary: If the property is defined, the control will animate all viewport items using this animation when it is initially bound to a data source.

member.name: F:Telerik.UI.Xaml.Controls.Data.ItemAnimationMode.PlayOnAdd
member.summary: If the property is defined, the control will animate each new item that is added to the source collection and is realized in the viewport.

member.name: F:Telerik.UI.Xaml.Controls.Data.ItemAnimationMode.PlayOnRemove
member.summary: If the property is defined, the control will animate each new item that is removed from the source collection and was realized in the viewport.

member.name: F:Telerik.UI.Xaml.Controls.Data.ItemAnimationMode.PlayOnSourceReset
member.summary: If the property is defined, the control will animate all viewport items out of the viewport.

member.name: F:Telerik.UI.Xaml.Controls.Data.ItemAnimationMode.PlayAll
member.summary: Animations are played always when the control is bound to a collection, when the source is reset, or when items are added/removed from the source collection.
